author: guitargeek
body:
Continuous integration is a blessing. I am convinced that by regular tiny PRs to the PFProducer/PFAlgo that are easy to review we can on a long term clear up the Particle Flow hairball.

I suggest here:
  * to replace most loops in PFAlgo with range based loops
  * to replace boost::shared_ptr with std::shared_ptr
  * to remove the PFAlgoTestBench* classes since they are probably not used any more and IMHO not well designed: they had rather special requirements of the class they are testing (vtable, protected member functions) which I consider not a good design. Testing should be independent of implementation. Also, removing these classes makes further refactoring easier because they don't have to be considered. @cbernet, what do you think about this? Are these test benches still needed?

Local matrix tests pass.
title: PFAlgo range based loops and TestBench removal
